description: From Middle English forspreden, equivalent to for- +‎ spread. Cognate with Dutch verspreiden (“to spread, disseminate, distribute”).

verbs.description: forspread (third-person singular simple present forspreads, present participle forspreading, simple past and past participle forspread)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, now chiefly dialectal) To spread; extend.
examples: Or ever with me the maw of the sepulchre fed becometh, Or e'er in the dust each part of my frame forspread becometh,  […]
